Body:
OS: Windows10

SDK: Microsoft.Azure.Devices v1.3.2

Language: C#

Hello, I´m developing a Windows Form Application on C#. In this app, I´m sending messages to my IoT Hub using the NuGet Packet Microsoft.Azure.Devices v1.3.2 and receive those messages on a raspberry pi. Ony with this package install, the app is about 30 MB, and that´s ok for me. The problem is that I need to receive messages from the IoT Hub in this app too, so what I did is to install the NuGetPacket Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client v1.5.0 that help me receive messages, but if I install this package, it increases the weight of the app like 300 MB more, and that´s way to heavier than I want it.

My question is, is there other way to receive message from my IoT Hub in my Windows Form Application without all that extra weight? Am I missing a package to help me do that in a more easy way? Thank you in advance.

Hmya, these Nuget packages have to keep entirely too many possible platform targets happy.  Everything and the kitchen-sink is included, .NETStandard is not nearly standard enough yet.  Focus on what you actually find back in your project's build directory.  Those 300 megabytes get whittled down to ~22 MB when I try it.
You can also use EventHubClient to receive message from Azure IoT Hub, which is in WindowsAzure.ServiceBus. WindowsAzure.ServiceBus has no dependencies
column10:
you can get the sample source code from azure-iot-sdk-csharp. The tool of DeviceExplorer use EventHubClient to receive message.

There are so much dependencies about Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client v1.5.0. When you use nuget to install Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Client
column11: the dependencies will be installed too. After building your project
column12: you can find the *.dll libraries in you output directory. If you want to reduce package's capacity
column13: can remove some *.dll which are not used
column15: but it is not recommended. In fact
column16: all of the dependencies are about 20M
column17:
why the weight of your app increased to 300M maybe some other reason.

"
